body:
Hey @Emporea, not sure if this is still relevant to you, but I tried reaching out to the maintainers and didn't get a response, so I created a fork and updated most of the packages. You can find it here, and I would welcome PR, requests if you have any: https://github.com/dagshub/ml-workspace

BTW, the updated containers themselves on Docker Hub are here: 
- https://hub.docker.com/repository/docker/dagshub/ml-workspace-minimal
- https://hub.docker.com/repository/docker/dagshub/ml-workspace

Hey @Emporea and @deanp70 , thanks for the question and great to hear about your efforts to update the packages! 
Due to a variety of reasons like working on Corona projects and other work-related things, we were unfortunately not able to be very active here. We plan to become more active again and update the repositories and go through the issues very soon! Just Friday, we released a cool repository in the context of our work - and leveraging the ml-workspace repository - which you can find [here](https://github.com/sap/machine-learning-lab/).

@deanp70 Would you mind to create a PR with your changes so we can have a look and probably be able to merge them?
Edit: I have just seen that there is a PR already open with regards to package updates. Maybe there is an overlap.

issue.title: Update packages to latest version

repository.name: ml-workspace
repository.description: ðŸ›  All-in-one web-based IDE specialized for machine learning and data science.

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you for creating a pull request ðŸ™Œ â¤ï¸
-->

**What kind of change does this PR introduce?**
<!-- (Update "[ ]" to "[x]" to check a box) -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [x] New Feature
- [ ] Feature Improvment
- [ ] Refactoring
- [ ] Documentation
- [ ] Other, please describe:

**Description:**
<!--- Use this section to describe your changes.  Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? If your test fixes a specific issue, don't forget to reference the issue number. If your PR is still a work in progress, that's totally fine â€“ just include a note to let us know. -->
* Update code-server to latest version to fix the issue with auto-update (update links to extension and use verbose to show relevant error for link access).
* add notebook debugger to Jupyter Lab from xeus-python
* upgrade packages to latest version

**Checklist:**
<!--- Before you submit the PR, go over this checklist and make sure you can
tick off all the boxes. [] -> [x] -->

- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING](https://github.com/ml-tooling/ml-workspace/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) document.
- [x] My changes don't require a change to the documentation, or if they do, I've added all required information.

body: Super thrilled to see this project coming back @raethlein!

> Hey @Emporea and @deanp70 , thanks for the question and great to hear about your efforts to update the packages!
> Due to a variety of reasons like working on Corona projects and other work-related things, we were unfortunately not able to be very active here. We plan to become more active again and update the repositories and go through the issues very soon! Just Friday, we released a cool repository in the context of our work - and leveraging the ml-workspace repository - which you can find [here](https://github.com/sap/machine-learning-lab/).
> 
> @deanp70 Would you mind to create a PR with your changes so we can have a look and probably be able to merge them?
> Edit: I have just seen that there is a PR already open with regards to package updates. Maybe there is an overlap.

Indeed I mainly merged that commit and made sure everything still works. Great to hear you will look at the PR.
Yeah I would really welcome a continuation of this repository!
We have just merged in the PR with the updates ðŸ™‚
@raethlein Shall we expect a new version so we can update our docker images? Thanks!
@allenzhao Yes, we are working on a new version :) Unfortunately, I cannot tell the exact date but we should be able to release it in November

How many minutes does a build w/ GitHub Actions take?
- https://www.docker.com/blog/docker-github-actions/
- https://github.com/marketplace/actions/build-and-push-docker-images (by docker)

@westurner We have created a GitHub Actions to build the repository. So far, I have just tested building the minimal flavor locally via [act](https://github.com/nektos/act), but I have just triggered a GitHub Actions run in this repo (for the minimal version first to see whether it runs through). So, we shall soon know :)
